Detailed Description

Functions to work with two-dimensional fields storing data of different types.

Function Documentation

cvl_field_t* cvl_field_new (  size_t  element_size,
int  width,
int  height
) 
 

Parameters:
element_size The size of the data elements of the field.
width The width.
height The height.
Returns:
The field.
Creates a new field. This function will abort the program if (width * height) does not fit into an int or if (width * height * element_size) does not fit into a size_t, to prevent arithmetic overflows.

void cvl_field_free (  cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field to be freed.
Frees a field. All allocated memory will be freed. field may be NULL; this function will do nothing in this case.

size_t cvl_field_element_size (  const cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
Returns:
The size of one element of the field.
Returns the size of one element of a field.

int cvl_field_width (  const cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
Returns:
The width of the field.
Returns the width of a field.

int cvl_field_height (  const cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
Returns:
The height of the field.
Returns the height of a field.

void cvl_field_zero (  cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
Sets all elements in field to zero. Note that this may result in invalid element data, depending on the type of the data stored in field.

void cvl_field_copy (  cvl_field_t *  dst,
const cvl_field_t *  src
) 
 

Parameters:
dst The destination field.
src The source field.
Copies the contents of src into dst. Both fields must have the same dimensions and the same element size.

cvl_field_t* cvl_field_clone (  const cvl_field_t *  field  ) 
 

Parameters:
field The field to be cloned.
Returns:
An exact copy of the given field.
Clones a field.

void cvl_field_get_i (  const cvl_field_t *  field,
int  i,
void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
i The index of the element.
e The destination for the element.
Gets an element from a field. The index refers to all lines of the field one after another, from top to bottom and left to right.

void cvl_field_get (  const cvl_field_t *  field,
int  x,
int  y,
void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
x The x coordinate.
y The y coordinate.
e The destination for the element.
Gets an element from a field.

void cvl_field_get_r (  const cvl_field_t *  field,
int  x,
int  y,
void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
x The x coordinate.
y The y coordinate.
e The destination for the element.
Returns:
The element.
Gets an element from a field, with reflective indexing: arbitrary x and y values are accepted.

void cvl_field_set_i (  cvl_field_t *  field,
int  i,
const void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
i The index of the element.
e The element.
Sets the element at index i in field to e. The index refers to all lines of the field one after another, from top to bottom and left to right.

void cvl_field_set (  cvl_field_t *  field,
int  x,
int  y,
const void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
x The x coordinate.
y The y coordinate.
e The element.
Sets the element at x, y in field to v.

void cvl_field_fill_rect (  cvl_field_t *  field,
int  x,
int  y,
int  w,
int  h,
const void *  e
) 
 

Parameters:
field The field.
x The x coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
y The y coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.
w The width of the rectangle.
h The height of the rectangle.
e The data element that the rectangle will be filled with.
Fills a rectangle in a field.

void cvl_field_copy_rect (  cvl_field_t *  dst,
int  dst_x,
int  dst_y,
const cvl_field_t *  src,
int  src_x,
int  src_y,
int  rwidth,
int  rheight
) 
 

Parameters:
dst The destination field.
dst_x The x coordinate of the destination rectangle's upper left corner.
dst_y The y coordinate of the destination rectangle's upper left corner.
src The source field.
src_x The x coordinate of the source rectangle's upper left corner.
src_y The y coordinate of the source rectangle's upper left corner.
rwidth The width of the rectangle.
rheight The height of the rectangle.
Copies the given rectangle. The fields must have the same type. The areas may be in the same field, but they must not overlap!

bool cvl_field_stream_eof (  FILE *  f  ) 
 

Parameters:
f The input stream.
Returns:
EOF (true) or not EOF (false).
Tests whether there is more data readable from f.

bool cvl_field_read (  FILE *  f,
cvl_field_t **  field,
size_t  element_size,
bool(*)(const char *s, void *element)  read_element
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream to read from.
field The field will be stored here.
element_size The size of one data element.
read_element Function that converts a string to one element. Must return success or error.
Returns:
Success or error.
Reads a field from a stream. The type of the field must be known by the caller, so that the necessary conversion function can be provided.

bool cvl_field_write (  FILE *  f,
cvl_field_t *  field,
bool(*)(char *s, size_t s_size, const void *element)  write_element
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream to write the field to.
field The field.
write_element Function to convert one element into a fixed length string. Must return success or error.
Returns:
Success or error.
Writes a field to a stream.

bool cvl_field_seek_raw (  FILE *  f,
size_t  element_size,
int  width,
int  height,
int  newpos
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream.
element_size The size of a field element.
width The field width.
height The field height.
newpos The number of the requested field.
Returns:
Success or error.
Seeks to the requested field in the file f that stores fields with the given element_size, width, and height in raw binary format.

bool cvl_field_read_raw (  FILE *  f,
cvl_field_t *  field
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream to read from.
field A preallocated field to read the data into.
Returns:
Success or error.
Reads a field in raw binary data form from a stream into the preallocated field field. Exactly width*height*element_size bytes are read.

bool cvl_field_write_raw (  FILE *  f,
cvl_field_t *  field
) 
 

Parameters:
f The stream to write to.
field The field to write.
Returns:
Success or error.
Writes the field field into f in raw binary data form. Exactly width*height*element_size bytes are read.
